p: Ketoglutarate dehydrogenase (OGDH) is a key control point in the tricarboxylic acid cycle and serves as a main source of ROS generation in cells (Mailloux etÂ al. 2016a, 2016b). qPCR and western blotting analysis showed that RosA reduced ogdh mRNA and protein levels following myocardial I/R injury in mice and reduced ogdh mRNA and protein levels following OGD/R injury in cardiomyocytes, suggesting that RosA could inhibit OGDH to reduce ROS generation in tissues and cells.
